intro_first_time.text: Oh! H-hello—! I… I didn’t see you coming. I’m Alicia. Welcome to my shop! Uhm— please look around! And— and if you’re hungry, I can warm something up. Not for sale. Just… because.

intro_kind.text: M-me? No, I’m… I’m normal. I just… I don’t like when people look empty. Like they forgot they have a body. Sorry. That sounded weird.

intro_not_weird.text: …Thank you. People usually laugh. Or they say ‘that’s cute’ and then they don’t mean it. Anyway! Please— uhm— browse!

default.text: Oh! H-hello there! I… I didn’t see you coming! Uhm… welcome! Please look around. And— uh— drink water. People forget.

talk_menu.text: O-okay. What do you want to talk about? I’m not good at… normal conversations. I mean— I can talk! I just… talk too much.

talk_holding_up_normal.text: I’m fine! I mean— I’m… okay. Some days I’m made of feathers, and other days I’m made of bricks. Today is… moderately feather.

choices.label: You look tired. Did you eat?

talk_did_you_eat.text: Oh! That’s sweet… I did. Sort of. Tea counts, right? …No, don’t answer. If you say ‘no’ I’ll cry and then I’ll laugh and then I’ll cry again and it becomes a whole thing.

talk_offer_food.text: You don’t have to do that. I— I want to say yes though. That’s the problem with me. I want to say yes to everything that feels warm.

talk_warm_isnt_problem.text: …If you keep talking like that, I’ll start trusting you. And then I’ll get weird about it. So— um— thank you. Quietly. Okay?

talk_holding_up_spiral.text: …I’m okay. I’m okay. I’m okay. Sorry. If I say it three times it feels more true. Sometimes I… panic-clean the house. Like if everything is spotless, nothing bad can happen. Stupid, right?

talk_spiral_not_stupid.text: Thanks. People call me ‘dramatic’. But it’s not drama. It’s… math. If I don’t do the ritual, the bad thing comes. My brain doesn’t understand probability.

talk_laura_before_met.text: Laura? Oh— you haven’t met her? She’s… she’s the kind of person you notice even if you’re trying not to notice people. Tall. Blonde. Looks like she belongs in a painting that judges you.

talk_laura_introduce.text: I can’t just… present her like a gift! Sorry. That sounded— um— I’ll… I’ll try. She’s busy a lot. But I’ll try.

talk_laura.text: Have you seen Laura around? She’s… she’s so amazing, isn’t she? *sigh* Sometimes I wonder if— oh! Nevermind! People say weird things about us, but she’s just teasing! She’s been with Raphael for 7 years… I just want her to be happy.

choices.label: Do you feel safe with her?

talk_laura_weird_things.text: That she’s ‘using’ me. That she’s ‘cruel’. That I’m ‘too much’ and she likes that. But Laura isn’t cruel. She’s… honest. And I like honesty. Even when it hurts.

talk_laura_weapon.text: …Yeah. Sometimes it feels like a little knife with lipstick on it. But I deserve it. I mean— I probably do. I don’t know. Forget I said that.

talk_laura_deserve_pain.text: …Don’t say that so easily. If it’s true, I’ll have to rebuild my whole personality.

talk_laura_safe_deflect.text: Safe? Yes! Of course. She’s not— she’s not like that. I’m just… sensitive. That’s all.

talk_laura_safe_spiral.text: Safe…? I feel… *held*. Which is different. Sometimes held is safe. Sometimes held is a cage that smells like perfume.

talk_laura_heavy_sentence.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. See? I do the thing where I say something true and then I punish myself for it.

talk_dungeon.text: The dungeon… It’s not like normal ruins. It listens. It waits. You know how sometimes a room feels like it remembers you? It’s like that. But under your skin.

choices.label: Why do people go down there?

talk_dungeon_why.text: Money. Pride. Curiosity. Sometimes love. Sometimes revenge. Mostly… because the town is small, and if you don’t become someone, you become nothing.

quest_offer.text: Actually… could you help me find something for her? She loves sparkly things. Maybe if I gave her something special… she’d look at me like I’m… real.

quest_active.text: You’ll know it when you see it — a Glittering Teardrop. Merchants whisper about them. It’s… stupid, right? Like a fairytale trinket. But Laura likes fairytale trinkets when she thinks no one’s watching.

quest_turnin.text: Oh—! Is that…? It’s perfect. May I— may I have it? I’ll… I’ll make it matter.

quest_complete.text: Thank you. Laura will… she’ll love this. Or she’ll tease me and I’ll pretend it doesn’t hurt. Either way— it’s something. Here, take this as thanks. And— uhm— come back alive, okay?

intro_first_time.text: Well, hello there. New face. You look like someone who knows when to leave before things get ugly. That’s rare in this town. I’m Laura.

default.text: Well, hello there, darling. Looking for something shiny, or just admiring the view? I’m Laura. Goldsmith. Occasional problem.

talk_menu.text: Go on. Say what you mean. People here talk like they’re trying not to exist.

talk_alicia_cares.text: I know. That’s the problem, isn’t it? She feels things at full volume. If I’m not careful, I become the whole soundtrack.

talk_guilty_deflect.text: Guilt is for people who pretend they didn’t choose. I choose. Every day. Next question.

talk_guilty_vulnerable.text: …Yes. Not in the dramatic way. In the quiet way that sits in your ribs when you’re alone. I don’t want to hurt her. I just… don’t want to be owned by someone else’s need.

talk_guilty_honest.text: Honest doesn’t mean kind. But I’m trying. Tell Alicia I said that— and she’ll turn it into a religion, so actually don’t.

talk_raphael.text: Raphael? We’ve been engaged for seven years. He’s steady. Reliable. Dangerous in the way a smile can be dangerous. He knows how to sound gentle while moving you like furniture.

talk_love_deflect.text: Love is a big word. We function. That’s worth more than poetry down here.

talk_love_vulnerable.text: I love the part of him that doesn’t ask questions when I go quiet. I hate the part of him that thinks that means he owns me.

talk_dungeon.text: The dungeon is a wound the town pretends is a mine. People go down for ‘treasure’. But what they bring back is usually… an explanation for their suffering.

talk_dungeon_go.text: Sometimes. I’m not a good Summoner. I get distracted. I think about the wrong things. Then my MP runs thin and I start bargaining with myself. I always leave before it takes something I can’t replace.

state_alicia_entry.text: Alicia? Oh— speak of the devil…

state_alicia_hello.text: H-hello! I didn’t mean to interrupt! I just… brought the polish.

state_alicia_reply.text: Just put it on the table, dear. And try not to knock anything over this time, hmm?

state_player_says_something.text: Oh? Do you want to mediate our domestic comedy, Summoner?

state_player_be_gentle.text: …Fine. Alicia, come here. Look at me. Breathe. You’re not in trouble.

quest_offer.text: Actually, I need a favor. There’s a rare undead prowling the lower floors… rumor has it it wears a pure gold band. Bring it to me. Raw material for a project. Don’t ask which one.

quest_active.text: The signet I’m after is pristine gold. If you find an Untarnished Signet, bring it straight to me. And don’t clean it. I want the truth on it.

quest_turnin.text: You found it. Good. Hand it here— carefully. People think gold is soft. It isn’t. It remembers pressure.

quest_complete.text: This will do nicely. Here’s your payment— and my respect. Few bring back what they promise. Fewer come back without bragging about it.

default.text: Halt. The dungeon below is dangerous. Only authorized Summoners may pass.

allow_pass.text: Guild Pass verified. Keep your MP above the red line. Don’t be a hero in there— heroes become stains.

allow_pass_stains.text: People come back talking about ‘treasure’. Then they stop sleeping. Then they stop talking. Then we stop calling them by name. Go.

deny_pass.text: No Guild Pass. Speak to the Guildmaster in town. And don’t try to slip past. I’ve buried faster people than you.

intro.text: Oh— a living one. Don’t startle me like that. Here. I sell necessities. Not hope. Hope’s extra.

default.text: A friendly face in the dark. Care for supplies? It gets expensive the deeper you go. That’s the point.

advice.text: Advice? Keep one summon slot empty. The dungeon loves to tempt you when you’re at your limit. And never ‘push one more room’ when your MP is low. That’s how you become a story.

default.text: Blades, hammers, axes. If it kills, I sell it. If it breaks, I fix it. If you break, that’s on you.

talk_dungeon.text: Down there? Don’t fight fair. Don’t fight pretty. Fight to leave. The only winning move is coming back with your hands still yours.

default.text: Rare finds! Highest bidder takes all! …Well. Fixed price for now. But the *spirit* is the same. Spend like you’re trying to forget something.

talk_unid.text: It means you pay first and ask questions later. Just like love. Just like the dungeon. Now— are you brave, or are you smart?

intro_who.text: Daphne. I’m the part of the dungeon that learned to speak politely.

intro_not_answer.text: It is. You’re just not used to answers that don’t comfort you.

intro_late_for.text: For the version of you that doesn’t come back.

default.text: …Don’t waste steps. Don’t waste summons. Don’t waste yourself.

talk_dungeon.text: It doesn’t want you dead. It wants you *convinced*. There’s a difference. Dead things don’t pray. Convinced things do.

talk_town.text: A town is just a room with too many mirrors. Everyone here is looking for the angle that makes them forgivable.

default.text: Efficiency is key. Do not waste my time.

talk_summoner.text: I summon because I don’t trust people to stand where I need them. Creatures are honest. They take payment and they do the job.

talk_lonely.text: Lonely is a luxury. You’ll learn that if you keep surviving.

default.text: Heh. You look like you’ve seen a ghost. Want to hear a story? They’re all true. That’s what makes them useless.

story_1.text: Once, a Summoner ran out of MP and begged his own creature to stop draining him. The creature cried. Then it kept eating. The dungeon doesn’t make monsters. It just reveals who’s hungry.
